subject: Design
title: The Aldine Press: Inventing the Pocket Book
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Aldine Press: Inventing the Pocket Book.

hook.text: In 1501, Aldus Manutius shrank the book. Scholars could finally carry knowledge in a pocket.

buildup.text: Before him, books were heavy folios chained to desks. Reading meant visiting a library.

discovery.text: Manutius invented italic type to fit more text on smaller pages without losing readability.

climax.text: The pocket book turned reading from institutional activity to personal habit.

punchline.text: Changing a book's size changed who reads.

quiz.question: What did Aldus Manutius introduce to book design?
options: The portable octavo format and italic type
